<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 6"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Educate Allies](/Feats.aspx?ID=1642) <actions string="Reaction" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Abjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=2" />
<trait label="Bard" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=19" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 113 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Prerequisites**
[Well-Versed](/Feats.aspx?ID=1634)

**Trigger**
An ally benefiting from one of your composition spells is subject to an effect with the [auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=16), [illusion](/Traits.aspx?ID=92), [linguistic](/Traits.aspx?ID=101), [sonic](/Traits.aspx?ID=147), or [visual](/Traits.aspx?ID=163) trait.

</column>

---

You tweak the properties of your composition spell to convey a bit of your defensive knowledge. All allies affected by your composition spell gain your +1 circumstance bonus from [Well-Versed](/Feats.aspx?ID=1634) until the start of your next turn. Teaching your allies also bolsters your own skills; your personal circumstance bonus from Well-Versed also increases to +2 until the start of your next turn.
name: Educate Allies
